channel.title: Catalog Model on OSCAL
channel.description: Recent content in Catalog Model on OSCAL

item.title: Catalog Model JSON Format Outline
item.description: catalog [1]: {… }uuid [1]: uuid, metadata [1]: {… }, title [1]: markup-line, published [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, last-modified [1]: dateTime-with-timezone, version [1]: string, oscal-version [1]: string, revisions [0 or 1]: [ … ], An array of oscal-metadata-revision objects [1 to ∞]{ title [0 or 1]: markup-line, published [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, last-modified [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, version [0 or 1]: string, oscal-version [0 or 1]: string, props [0 or 1]: [ … ], An array of property objects [1 to ∞]{

item.title: Control Catalog Model JSON Format Reference
item.description: OSCAL model OSCAL Control Catalog Model Version 1.0.0-rc1 JSON Schema oscal_catalog_schema.json XML to JSON converter oscal_catalog_xml-to-json-converter.xsl (How do I use the converter to convert OSCAL XML to JSON?) The OSCAL Control Catalog format can be used to describe a collection of security controls and related control enhancements, along with contextualizing documentation and metadata. The root of the Control Catalog format is catalog. Switch to XML addr-line formal name Address line A single line of an address.

item.title: OSCAL Catalog Model XML Format Outline
item.description: <catalog uuid="uuid">… </catalog>[1]<metadata>… </metadata>[1]<title>markup-line</title>[1] <published>datetime-with-timezone</published>[0 or 1] <last-modified>datetime-with-timezone</last-modified>[1] <version>string</version>[1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version>[1] <revisions>… </revisions>[0 or 1]<revision>… </revision>[0 to ∞]<title>markup-line</title>[0 or 1] <published>datetime-with-timezone</published>[0 or 1] <last-modified>datetime-with-timezone</last-modified>[0 or 1] <version>string</version>[0 or 1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version>[0 or 1] <prop name="ncname" uuid="uuid" ns="uri" value="string" class="ncname">… </prop>[0 to ∞]<remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1] </prop> <link href="uri-reference" rel="ncname" media-type="string">… </link>[0 to ∞]<text>markup-line</text>[0 or 1] </link> <remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1] </revision> </revisions> <document-id scheme="uri">string</document-id>[0 to ∞] <prop name="ncname" uuid="uuid" ns="uri" value="string" class="ncname">… </prop>[0 to ∞]<remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1]

item.title: OSCAL Catalog Model XML Format Reference
item.description: OSCAL model OSCAL Control Catalog Model Version 1.0.0-rc1 XML namespace http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal/1.0 XML Schema oscal_catalog_schema.xsd JSON to XML converter oscal_catalog_json-to-xml-converter.xsl (How do I use the converter to convert OSCAL JSON to XML?) The OSCAL Control Catalog format can be used to describe a collection of security controls and related control enhancements, along with contextualizing documentation and metadata. The root of the Control Catalog format is catalog. Switch to JSON addr-line formal name Address line A single line of an address.
